revised_title: Discovery of Roman Copper Coins in Lincolnshire
tldr: In 1702, a man named Edward Lenton discovered a pot containing 36 pounds of Roman copper coins in Lincolnshire, England. The coins were found in a flat, low-lying area that was once covered by water. The pot had an inscription that was not legible, but it caught the attention of the scientific community and provided insight into the history of the region.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
